properties.name: Object Selection
properties.description: Demonstrate how objects are selected using a Basic and Advanced example.

objects.name: Message_Left
objects.string:
LEFT CLICK:

Click on (or touch) a tank to turn it green.

Click on a button to turn the specified tanks green.

content.text:
LEFT CLICK:

Click on (or touch) a tank to turn it green.

Click on a button to turn the specified tanks green.

objects.name: Message_Right
objects.string:
RIGHT CLICK:

Hold right mouse button to turn the tank 
closest to the mouse green.

content.text:
RIGHT CLICK:

Hold right mouse button to turn the tank 
closest to the mouse green.

events.name: Reset tank color when a mouse button is released

events.comment:
When either LEFT or RIGHT mouse button is released, turn ALL tanks to BLUE (by changing their animation)
This action affects ALL tanks because there are no references to tank objects in the conditions
events.comment2: Si aucun bouton n'est appuy�, TOUS les tanks deviennent bleus.

events.comment: Evaluate subevents once per left-click/touch

If the mouse/touch is over a tank, only the tank under the pointer will be changed to GREEN (by changing it's animation)
This action ONLY affects the tank that met the condition
Use "Pick a random" condition to select one instance at random.  The action will only affect a single instance of tank

Turn ALL tanks green when the "All Tanks" button is pushed
This action affects ALL tanks because there are no references to tank objects in the conditions
Hold RIGHT mouse button to pick the nearest tank
Start with ALL tanks using the BLUE
Turn the tank CLOSEST to the mouse to GREEN

content.text: Drag the cats in and out of the box

content.text: ALL cats in collision with box?

content.text: ANY cats in collision with box? (1 or more)

events.name: Are ANY cats in collision with box?

events.comment: If this condition is NOT true, then the text objects will NOT get updated (and stay blank)
If the button is pushed, shake all picked instances
Pick all objects can be helpful if a previous condition filtered out some objects but you want the action to apply to all instances of the object

events.name: Are ALL cats in collision with box?

events.comment: If this condition is NOT true, then the text objects will NOT get updated (and stay blank)
If the button is pushed, shake all picked instances
Notice that NO instances are picked.  "Pick all instances" MUST be used if actions are to be performed on the instances.
Pick all objects can be helpful if a previous condition filtered out some objects but you want the action to apply to all instances of the object

events.name: Are ANY cats NOT in collision with box?

events.comment: If this condition is NOT true, then the text objects will NOT get updated (and stay blank)
If the button is pushed, shake all picked instances
Pick all objects can be helpful if a previous condition filtered out some objects but you want the action to apply to all instances of the object

events.name: Are ZERO cats in collision with box?

events.comment: If this condition is NOT true, then the text objects will NOT get updated (and stay blank)
If the button is pushed, shake all picked instances
Notice that NO instances are picked.  "Pick all instances" MUST be used if actions are to be performed on the instances.
Pick all objects can be helpful if a previous condition filtered out some objects but you want the action to apply to all instances of the object

events.name: Highlight the cats in collision with box
Make cats bigger when mouse is over them
Tint cats when mouse is over them
Outline buttons when mouse is over them

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Checkbox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Checkbox that can be toggled by a left-click or touch.
description: Users can click on the checkbox to add and remove the checkmark.
- Add this extension to a shape painter object
- Use condition "Is checked" to find out the state of the checkbox
- Checkbox state can also be changed by an action.
- Checkbox can be disabled so that users cannot interact with it
- To remove halo, Set "halo hover" and "halo pressed" opacity to 0

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Checkbox that can be toggled by a left-click or touch.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Checkbox

events.comment: Make sure object doesn't get re-drawn every frame
Start halo at same size as thumb
Grow halo even more when pressed
Detect press ending
Detect hover and  touch/click
Detect mouse clicks near checkbox
Reset hover detection
Grow halo when hovered
Shrink halo to zero when not hovered
Redraw checkbox only when halo is not at final size
Fix inputs that create malformed checkboxes
Set halo radius, if not specified
Check if halo is bigger than checkbox
Prepare halo
Draw halo (it will grow or shrink as needed)
Use a more opaque halo while being dragged (it will grow or shrink as needed)
Change shape painter based on properties
Prepare color of checkmark
Draw left-side of checkmark
Draw right-side of checkmark

eventsFunctions.description: Check (or uncheck) the checkbox.
eventsFunctions.name: SetChecked

eventsFunctions.description: Enable or disable interactions with the checkbox. Users cannot interact while it is disabled.
eventsFunctions.name: SetEnabled

events.comment: Stop dragging (so the checkbox won't be dragging when it gets enabled)
Reset halo size (so halo won't appear when checkbox gets enabled)

eventsFunctions.description: If checked, change to unchecked.  If unchecked, change to checked.
eventsFunctions.name: ToggleChecked

eventsFunctions.description: Change the primary color of checkbox.
eventsFunctions.name: SetPrimaryColor

eventsFunctions.description: Change the secondary color of checkbox.
eventsFunctions.name: SetSecondaryColor

eventsFunctions.description: Change the halo opacity when pressed.
eventsFunctions.name: SetHaloOpacityPressed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the halo opacity of _PARAM0_ when pressed: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the halo opacity when hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: SetHaloOpacityHover
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the halo opacity of _PARAM0_ when hovered: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the halo radius when pressed.
eventsFunctions.name: SetHaloRadiusPressed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the halo radius of _PARAM0_ when pressed: _PARAM2_ px

eventsFunctions.description: Change the halo radius when hovered. This size is also used to detect interaction with the checkbox.
eventsFunctions.name: SetHaloRadiusHover
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the halo radius of _PARAM0_ when hovered: _PARAM2_ px

eventsFunctions.description: Change the border thickness of checkbox.
eventsFunctions.name: SetBorderThickness
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the border thickness of _PARAM0_: _PARAM2_ px

eventsFunctions.description: Change the side length of checkbox.
eventsFunctions.name: SetSideLength
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the side length of _PARAM0_: _PARAM2_ px

eventsFunctions.description: Change the line width of checkmark.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLineWidth
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the line width of _PARAM0_: _PARAM2_ px

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the checkbox is checked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsChecked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the checkbox interations are enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: IsEnabled

eventsFunctions.description: Return the color used to draw the outline of the checkbox (when unchecked) and the fill color (when checked).
eventsFunctions.name: PrimaryColor

eventsFunctions.description: Return the color used to fill the checkbox (when unchecked) and to draw the checkmark (when checked).
eventsFunctions.name: SecondaryColor

eventsFunctions.description: Return the radius of the halo while the checkbox is touched or clicked.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Halo radius while touched or clicked
eventsFunctions.name: HaloRadiusPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Return the opacity of the halo while the checkbox is touched or clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: HaloOpacityPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Return the radius of the halo when the mouse is hovering near the checkbox.
eventsFunctions.name: HaloRadiusHover

eventsFunctions.description: Return the opacity of the halo when the mouse is hovering near the checkbox.
eventsFunctions.name: HaloOpacityHover

eventsFunctions.description: Return the line width of checkmark (pixels).
eventsFunctions.name: LineWidth

eventsFunctions.description: Return the side length of checkbox (pixels).
eventsFunctions.name: SideLength

eventsFunctions.description: Return the border thickness of checkbox (pixels).
eventsFunctions.name: BorderThickness

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the checkbox is being pressed by mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsBeingPressed
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ is being pressed by mouse or touch

eventsFunctions.description: Update the hitbox.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateHitbox

events.comment: Include border in the collision mask

propertyDescriptors.label: Halo size (hover). If blank, this is set to "SideLength".
propertyDescriptors.name: HaloRadiusHover

propertyDescriptors.label: State of the checkbox has changed. (Used in "ToggleChecked" function)
propertyDescriptors.name: ToggleChanged

propertyDescriptors.label: Primary color of checkbox. (Example: 24;119;211) Fill color when box is checked.
propertyDescriptors.name: PrimaryColor

propertyDescriptors.label: Secondary color of checkbox. (Example: 255;255;255) Color of checkmark when box is checked.
propertyDescriptors.name: SecondaryColor

propertyDescriptors.label: Line width of checkmark (px) (Min: 1, Max: 1/4 * SideLength)
propertyDescriptors.name: LineWidth

propertyDescriptors.label: Border thickness (px) This border is only visible when the checkbox is unchecked.
propertyDescriptors.name: BorderThickness

propertyDescriptors.label: Halo size (pressed). If blank, this is set to "HaloRadiusHover * 1.1"
propertyDescriptors.name: HaloRadiusPressed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Shake objects with translation and rotation.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables

eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Calculate Scale shake
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
ScaleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Every even shake, increase scale
Every "odd" shake, decrease scale
ScaleDisplacement = -1 * (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)
